intro: Thlaspiceras elegans, commonly known as the elegant thlaspiceras, is a rare and lesser-known species within the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of many members of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas or along streambanks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
